body:
Reviewed 8 of 8 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

*[src/core/ext/transport/chttp2/transport/chttp2_transport.cc, line 1427 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-KyvvjcVKW_zTsn3wARO:-KyvvjcVKW_zTsn3wARP:bpwrr3g) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aaa24733770f179fa1c615b49f3ea4766ea16f69/src/core/ext/transport/chttp2/transport/chttp2_transport.cc#L1427)):*
> ```cpp
>     GRPC_STATS_INC_HTTP2_OP_CANCEL(exec_ctx);
>     GRPC_ERROR_UNREF(s->cancel_error);
>     s->cancel_error = GRPC_ERROR_REF(op_payload->cancel_stream.cancel_error);
> ```

We're setting this, but it doesn't look like we're actually using it for anything.

---

*[src/core/ext/transport/inproc/inproc_transport.cc, line 895 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-KyvvwYMEPO7QP5Yplaz:-KyvvwYMEPO7QP5Yplb-:bxkxsy8) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aaa24733770f179fa1c615b49f3ea4766ea16f69/src/core/ext/transport/inproc/inproc_transport.cc#L895)):*
> ```cpp
>     cancel_stream_locked(exec_ctx, s, op->payload->cancel_stream.cancel_error);
>     GRPC_ERROR_UNREF(s->cancel_error);
>     s->cancel_error = GRPC_ERROR_REF(op->payload->cancel_stream.cancel_error);
> ```

Similar question here: It looks like we're recording this but never using it for anything.

---

*[src/core/lib/surface/call.cc, line 677 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-Kyvw6L4t1RtbFBBwC8O:-Kyvw6L4t1RtbFBBwC8P:bvsr92h) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aaa24733770f179fa1c615b49f3ea4766ea16f69/src/core/lib/surface/call.cc#L677)):*
> ```cpp
> static void cancel_with_error(grpc_exec_ctx *exec_ctx, grpc_call *c,
>                               status_source source, grpc_error *error) {
>   int old_level = gpr_atm_no_barrier_load(&c->cancel_level);
> ```

If I'm understanding this right, this code is still trying to figure out how to prioritize between the various errors that can be returned from various batches.  I thought that the goal of this change was to ensure that we always use the status returned from the recv_trailing_metadata op, so that we don't have to do anything special here at all (e.g., no need for any atomic ops).

In particular, the reason I care about this is that whatever logic exists here will also need to be duplicated in the retry code.  The ideal case is that all we need to do is look at the result of recv_trailing_metadata, so that we minimize the amount of code that needs to be duplicated.

Note that in order to do this right, any filter that currently sets `GRPC_ERROR_INT_GRPC_STATUS` on an error will need to be changed to somehow save the status value until recv_trailing_metadata is returned.

---

Review status: 0 of 1 files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions. --- *[src/core/lib/surface/call.cc, line 677 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-Kyvw6L4t1RtbFBBwC8O:-L--PPHdO7ilgDcWSZq3:byufupl) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/aaa24733770f179fa1c615b49f3ea4766ea16f69/src/core/lib/surface/call.cc#L677)):*
Previously, markdroth (Mark D. Roth) wrote…
If I'm understanding this right, this code is still trying to figure out how to prioritize between the various errors that can be returned from various batches. I thought that the goal of this change was to ensure that we always use the status returned from the recv_trailing_metadata op, so that we don't have to do anything special here at all (e.g., no need for any atomic ops). In particular, the reason I care about this is that whatever logic exists here will also need to be duplicated in the retry code. The ideal case is that all we need to do is look at the result of recv_trailing_metadata, so that we minimize the amount of code that needs to be duplicated. Note that in order to do this right, any filter that currently sets `GRPC_ERROR_INT_GRPC_STATUS` on an error will need to be changed to somehow save the status value until recv_trailing_metadata is returned.
The original intent here was to duplicate the existing ranking of errors to determine, and possibly send down another cancellation if we encounter a "higher rated" error. After thinking about this comment for a bit, I realized that only the first cancellation was making any difference for the status that we "faked" (at least in the chttp2 transport). I also realized that any failure status from the wire (even if it was faked) __almost always__ was the highest rated error, not including STATUS_FROM_API_OVERRIDE. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368)*

Previously, kpayson64 wrote…
The original intent here was to duplicate the existing ranking of errors to determine, and possibly send down another cancellation if we encounter a "higher rated" error. After thinking about this comment for a bit, I realized that only the first cancellation was making any difference for the status that we "faked" (at least in the chttp2 transport). I also realized that any failure status from the wire (even if it was faked) __almost always__ was the highest rated error, not including STATUS_FROM_API_OVERRIDE.
This approach looks mostly reasonable to me, although I'd like @ctiller to weigh in before we merge this. I'm not entirely sure that there aren't timing issues that we might be missing here. If this checks out, then I think what this means is that the retry code just needs to make sure to send cancellations back down the stack whenever a batch fails, and then wait for recv_trailing_metadata to figure out the final status. That seems quite doable. --- *[src/core/lib/surface/call.cc, line 675 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-L-7iov0rQcsL47h2qr7:-L-7iov0rQcsL47h2qr8:b-5ebcfm) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/5a09c566d9043b8dcf4ad953348c6636490c3cdd/src/core/lib/surface/call.cc#L675)):* > ```cpp > } > > static void set_final_status(grpc_exec_ctx* exec_ctx, grpc_error* error, > ``` This function should take ownership of `error`, as per: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/core/grpc-error.md#ownership-rules --- *[src/core/lib/surface/call.cc, line 678 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-L-7iBcoTVeDLc47_vad:-L-7iBcoTVeDLc47_vae:b8bmjwj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/5a09c566d9043b8dcf4ad953348c6636490c3cdd/src/core/lib/surface/call.cc#L678)):* > ```cpp > grpc_call* call) { > if (grpc_call_error_trace.enabled()) { > gpr_log(GPR_ERROR, "set_final_status %s", call->is_client ? "CLI" : "SVR"); > ``` These should probably be `GPR_DEBUG` instead of `GPR_ERROR`. --- *[src/core/lib/surface/call.cc, line 1227 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368#-L-7q2oBsMe0pndpSiHt:-L-7q2oBsMe0pndpSiHu:b-30eg5j) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/5a09c566d9043b8dcf4ad953348c6636490c3cdd/src/core/lib/surface/call.cc#L1227)):* > ```cpp > *call->receiving_buffer = nullptr; > } > reset_batch_errors(bctl); > ``` Why do this here instead of just unreffing the errors when the batch_control struct is unreffed? --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/13368)*
